verb.description: Push one's lips or one's bottom lip forward as an expression of petulant annoyance or in order to make oneself look sexually attractive.
examples: she lounged on the steps, pouting
he shrugged and pouted his lips
synonyms: turn the corners of one's mouth down

examples: his lower lip protruded in a sulky pout

origin: Old English pūta (only in ǣlepūta eelpout); related to Dutch puit frog, chub, puitaal eelpout, and perhaps to pout.
